metadata.name: Persistence Via Sticky Key Backdoor
metadata.comment: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system. When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('copy ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/y ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\cmd.exe c:\\windows\\system32\\sethc.exe')))

output.summary: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system. When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.
